docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- Several years ago, when regulations of the Food and Drug Administration were being tightened, some food industry officials complained that they might soon need special permission from the Government to put mustard on a frankfurter.

headline.main: Food; Fresh Look at What Is and Is Not Safe to Eat

docs.abstract: some of ramifications of ban discussed; cartoon
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON -- Several years ago, when regulations of the Food and Drug Administration were being tightened, some food industry officials complained that they might soon need special permission from the Government to put mustard on a frankfurter.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 -- A consumer affairs message that promises to disappoint advocates of strong legislative and administrative action will be sent to Congress, possibly next week, by President Nixon.

headline.main: Nixon Consumer Plan Due; Nixon's Consumer Message Is Awaited

docs.abstract: Pres Nixon consumer message seen calling for revival of dormant Consumer Counsel Office
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 -- A consumer affairs message that promises to disappoint advocates of strong legislative and administrative action will be sent to Congress, possibly next week, by President Nixon.

byline.original: By JOHN D. MORRISSpecial to The New York Times
